label: MQTT
info:
Receive MQTT packets
  - listen for announce and LWT messages
  - negotiate incoming data format (CSVtoJSON)
  - negotiate packet reporting intervals
    - initially accept board defaults
    - but allow for pushing commands to update intervals
Process MQTT packets
  - CSVtoJSON
  - link out to individual flows for 
    error checking and processing
Broadcast outgoing:
  - commands
  - queries

label: Base Station
info:
Use this flow for:
  - local GPIO (buttons/indicators/etc)
  - serial data in/out
  - I2C/SPI

label: Environmental Processing
info:
Use this for actual processing of:
  - derived SLP from barometer and known altitude
  - altitude calculations
  - temp/humidity baselines
  - etc

ENSURE THAT ALL LINKS IN/OUT & DASHBOARD
I/O WON'T CRASH IF ENTIRE FLOW IS DISABLED

label: File Handling
info:
Accept inputs for:
  - logging level (raw, refined, both)
  - selection of available fields
  - user defined path/filename(s)

Output:
  - disable messages for select user interfaces
  - LED indicator of logging status
  - dashboard indicator of logging status
  - data to indicated path/filename(s)

label: Data Packet Analysis
info:
FOR NOW:
  - (COLLAPSE) raw packet feed
  - Livestream line graph of SNR
  - (COLLAPSE) Breakout of packet data

FUTURE GROWTH
  - Live Radar plot of data (latest OR average)
  -

label: Internet Requests
info:
Use this flow for internet requests
 - not sure if this will double for 
   intranet/off grid applications like
   local NTP services, pings, etc

label: Diagnostics Panel
info:
ENSURE SYSTEM WILL WORK WITH THIS ENTIRE 
FLOW DISABLED
  - For each Remote Unit: separate groups,
    - individually collapsible
  - For each report:
    - data breakout & headers
    - last report timestamp
    - unit status (on/offline) derived from:
      - any unacknowledged command or query
      - overdue report / missed interval
      - select data outside expected parameters
        - ie azimuth changed x% more than RPM
        - ie timestamp >x% lagged
        - ie timestamp in the future
    - set error status based on that
      - TOTALLY offline
      - Missed report interval
      - Unacknowledged command/query
      - No response / no report = RED
      - Late / no acknowledge but reporting = YELLOW
      - Data out of parameters - TBD

label: REMOTE BMP
info: Use this flow for processing/displaying remote BMP data

name: Initial trigger, immediate reset, then 5s delay message IFF not retriggered
Pass array after all 3 parts arrive OR 5sec timeout, then single payload
Pass array after ANY 2 parts arrive
INITIALLY, only pass array after 3 parts arrive. Afterwards, any single input retriggers whole message
Calc SLP

Proper way would be to extrapolate from known sensor altitude of 4 meters

$boolean(arg)
func:
// $boolean(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            unchanged
string: empty	    false
string: non-empty	true
number: 0	        false
number: non-zero	true
null	            false
array: empty	    false
array: any true	    true
array: all false	false
object: empty	    false
object: non-empty	true
function	        false
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Casts the argument to a Boolean
const expression = [
    jsonata("$boolean(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $not(arg)
func:
// $not(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            opposite
string: empty	    true
string: non-empty	false
number: 0	        true
number: non-zero	false
null	            true
array: empty	    true
array: any true	    false
array: all false	true
object: empty	    true
object: non-empty	false
function	        true
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean NOT on the argument, the revese of $boolean()
const expression = [
    jsonata("$not(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $exists(arg)
func:
// $exists(arg)

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean, true if the arg expression evaluates to a value
// or false if the expression does not match anything
const expression = [
    jsonata("$exists(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;
